Filter_attribute_syntax.description: Specifies the syntax that the 'Filter' attribute can take in SharpPcap.

Ethernet.description: Filters packets based on the destination MAC address.

IPv4.description: Filters packets based on the source IPv4 address.

IPv6.description: Filters packets based on the destination IPv6 address.

TCP.description: Filters traffic on port 80, typically used for HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol).

UDP.description: Filters traffic on port 53, typically used for DNS (Domain Name System).

ICMP.description: Filters ICMP (Internet Control Message Protocol) packets (ping, traceroute, etc.).

DNS.description: Filters traffic on port 53, typically used for DNS (Domain Name System).

HTTP.description: Filters traffic on port 80, typically used for HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol).

HTTPS.description: Filters traffic on port 443, typically used for HTTPS (HTTP Secure).

FTP.description: Filters traffic on port 21, typically used for FTP (File Transfer Protocol).

SMTP.description: Filters traffic on port 25, typically used for SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol).

POP3.description: Filters traffic on port 110, typically used for POP3 (Post Office Protocol version 3).

IMAP.description: Filters traffic on port 143, typically used for IMAP (Internet Message Access Protocol).
